availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William S. Humphries (Trigg County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Berthena Wall Humphries and Absalom Humphries. Married to Mary Jane Williams Humphries in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on September 7, 1843. Farmer in Trigg County in 1850. Owned twelve enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1850.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 1, p. 310A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 1, p. 247.
Find A Grave, "Berthena Humphries (1776-1851)," Memorial #49457029, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49457029 (accessed March 8, 2021).
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film #000482707.
